title: %#p is supposed to print addresses without leading 0x; but doesn't
body:
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull -u" and retry what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Print the address of anything using %p and %#p

What is the expected output?
With %p you should get 0xh... and according to the fmt docs with %#p you should get
h.... (i.e., no leading 0x)

What do you see instead?
%#p outputs exactly the same as %p


Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g

Which operating system are you using?
debian testing 64-bit

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
322350d6fdbf+ release/release.2011-02-24
